intro: Pentaschistis acinosa var. truncatula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yew, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It is characterized by its small, dark green, ovate leaves that are typically arranged in whorls along the stems. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
